alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bennington and northern Windham Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Wardsboro, or near Stratton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Londonderry, Townshend, Stratton, Saxtons River, Newfane, West Wardsboro, Windham, Rockingham, Dover, Jamaica, Wardsboro, Grafton, Brookline, Athens, Peru, Somerset, Wardsboro Center, Goose City, Brockways Mills and South Windham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
